TableField.name: ChemicalInventoryID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track chemical inventory and storage practices

TableField.name: ChemicalID
TableField.phrase: Chemical ID|An automatically assigned number used to track material safety data sheets for chemicals used by the organization

ForeignField.name: Chemical
ForeignField.phrase: Chemical Name|The common name of the chemical stored at this location

TableField.name: OrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for this record. Access to this record can be restricted to those users directly associated with the same organization

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for this record. Access to this record can be restricted to those users directly associated with the same organization

RemoteField.name: PersonAccountableID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Accountable|The person with primary accountability for managing the chemical inventory item

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The person with primary accountability for managing the chemical inventory item

RemoteField.name: DepartmentID
RemoteField.phrase: Department Responsible|Department responsible for the management of the chemical at the specific location identified

ForeignField.name: Department
ForeignField.phrase: Department Responsible|Department responsible for the management of the chemical at the specific location identified

RemoteField.name: LocationID
RemoteField.phrase: Location|Specific location within the facility where the chemical is stored or used

ForeignField.name: Location
ForeignField.phrase: Location|Specific location within the facility where the chemical is stored or used

TableField.name: ChemicalStorageMethodID
TableField.phrase: Storage Method|The specific method used to store the chemical on site

CodeField.name: ChemicalStorageMethod
CodeField.phrase: Storage Method|The specific method used to store the chemical on site

TableField.name: TrackingNumber
TableField.phrase: Container Number|A unique tracking number fixed to the storage container/s

TableField.name: StorageDesc
TableField.phrase: Storage Description|A detailed description of the method and manner of storage for this chemical
TableField.sample: The Methyl Ethyl Goo is stored in drums atop secondary containment pallets

TableField.name: ReOrderQuantity
TableField.phrase: Reorder Quantity|The inventory quantity at which the chemical should be ordered to replentish the inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: StartQuantity
TableField.phrase: Start Quantity|The quantity of chemical at this location when tracking begins

TableField.name: StartQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: StartQuantityUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: StartQuantityUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: StartQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

RemoteField.name: StartDate
RemoteField.phrase: Start Date|The date the start quantity was entered

TableField.name: Issued
TableField.phrase: Issued|The amount of inventory issued or checked out from this specific location

TableField.name: IssuedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: IssuedUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: IssuedUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: IssuedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Returned
TableField.phrase: Returned|The amount of inventory returned or checked in to iventory at this specific location

TableField.name: ReturnedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: ReturnedUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: ReturnedUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: ReturnedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Added
TableField.phrase: Added|New amount of inventory added to the inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: AddedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: AddedUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: AddedUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: AddedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Transferred
TableField.phrase: Transferred|Items of this chemical which were transferred to another location

TableField.name: TransferredUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: TransferredUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: TransferredUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: TransferredUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: PresentQuantity
TableField.phrase: Present Quantity|The present quantity of chemical at this location. The present quantity is based on a manual count of items in inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: PresentQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: PresentQuantityUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: PresentQuantityUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: PresentQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: PresentQuantityDate
TableField.phrase: Present Quantity Date|An automatically recorded date when the present quantity was appended

RemoteField.name: PresentQuantityPersonID
RemoteField.phrase: Present Quantity Person|The individual determining and recording the present quantity

ForeignField.name: PresentQuantityPerson
ForeignField.phrase: Present Quantity Person|The individual determining and recording the present quantity

TableField.name: BeginningCalculationDate
TableField.phrase: Beginning Calculation Date|The beginning date used for calculating pertinent indicators and losses between the beginning calculation date and ending calculation Date

TableField.name: EndingCalculationDate
TableField.phrase: Ending Calculation Date|The ending date used for calculating pertinent indicators and losses between the beginning calculation date and ending calculation Date

TableField.name: LossQuantity
TableField.phrase: Loss Quantity|The quantity of chemical which cannot be accounted for but is unavailable. Lost chemical is any chemical which cannot be accounted for by chemical which was issued and not returned

TableField.name: LossQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: LossQuantityUoMCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: LossQuantityUoMCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: LossQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: LossCost
TableField.phrase: Loss Cost|The financial cost of losses associated with this chemical at this specific location as of the Calculation Date

TableField.name: MaxAmountAllowed
TableField.phrase: Maximum Amount Allowed|Maximum amount of chemical allowed to be stored at this specific location at any one time

TableField.name: MaxAmtUoMID
TableField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: MaxAmtUnitCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: MaxAmtUnitCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: MaxAmtUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

TableField.name: AmountPerYear
TableField.phrase: Amount Per Year|Amount of chemical stored at this specific location per year

TableField.name: AmtPerYrUoMID
TableField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: AmtPerYrUnitCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: AmtPerYrUnitCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: AmtPerYrUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

TableField.name: AmountPerDay
TableField.phrase: Amount Per Day|Amount of chemical stored at this specific location per day

TableField.name: AmtPerDayUoMID
TableField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: AmtPerDayUnitCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: AmtPerDayUnitCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: AmtPerDayUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

TableField.name: DaysOnSite
TableField.phrase: Days On Site Per Year|Number of days this chemical is stored at this specific location per year

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes
CombinedField.sample: Water | Active Agenda, Inc. | Development Zone

CombinedField.name: PresentInventoryQuantity
CombinedField.phrase: Present Quantity|A combined field used to describe the present chemical inventory quantity when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: 3M 3710 Dust Mask; Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710

CombinedField.name: ChemicalInventory
CombinedField.phrase: Chemical|A combined field used to describe this chemical when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: Water; Hydrogen Dioxide; 1336-21-6; Discontinued; Active Agenda, HQ; Packaging Area

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
